text.text: The Apple II is one of the world's first large-scale personal computers. Designed by Steve Wozniak and marketed on June 10, 1977 by Apple, it began its career with passionate individuals. The Apple II uses an 8-bit architecture, 4 KB of RAM, a cassette player and allows a display in 280x192 in 6 colors in composite video output. The Apple IIe Enhanced released in 1984 has 128k of RAM. Its display evolves to reach 560x192 in monochrome, 280x192 in 6 colors and 140x192 in 16 colors. Apple will stop production of its Apple II line in 1993.
